models package¶

Submodules¶

models.knn module¶

KNN model definitions¶

classes¶

  • knn: holds the KNN data points and calculates test point results

  • knn_error: manage error generated by the knn model

class models.knn.knn(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

K-Nearest Neighbor model class

DEBUG_MSG = True¶
ERROR_MSG = True¶
LOGGER = <util.log.log.log object>¶
test_point(test_x: ndarray, K: int) → list[source]¶

Get KNN prediction on a new point.

Parameters¶

test_xnp.ndarray or list

Test point to get the KNN prediction on.

K: int

The value of K for this given data point.

Returns¶

y_hat: list of label_type

An array of predicted values of the label given test point and K value

exception models.knn.knn_error(message)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

models.lasso_regression module¶

models.lasso_regression.lasso(X: array, y: array, lam: float)[source]¶

apply lasso regression (L1 regularization) on a given set of data

Parameters:

  • X – is expected in the regular design matrix format X = (1 x1 x2 …) size = n x (p+1)

  • y – measured response vector (is a row vector by default by python, but in mathematical terms, it is a column vector)

  • lam – hyperparameter lambda of lasso regression

Returns:

the lasso regression parameters

models.linear_regression module¶

Linear regression model definitions

methods * linear_regression(X: np.ndarray, y: np.ndarray, one_column: bool): trains a linear regression model from given data

models.linear_regression.linear_regression(X: ndarray, y: ndarray, one_column: bool) → ndarray[source]¶

apply linear regression on a given set of data

Parameters:

  • X – design matrix in format X = (1 x1 x2 …) size = n x (p+1) or X = (x1 x2 …) size = n x p

  • y – training data response vector

  • one_column – set False if the input design matrix lacks the leading one column to add it in post

Returns:

linear regression (the least squares) parameters (intercept, B1, B2, …, Bp)

Return type:

np.ndarray

models.log_r module¶

models.log_r.log_r()[source]¶

models.ridge_regression module¶

models.ridge_regression.ridge(X: array, y: array, lam: float)[source]¶

apply ridge regression (L2 regularization) on a given set of data

Parameters:

  • X – is expected in the regular design matrix format X = (1 x1 x2 …) size = n x (p+1)

  • y – measured response vector (is a row vector by default by python, but in mathematical terms, it is a column vector)

  • lam – hyperparameter lambda of ridge regression

Returns:

the ridge regression parameters

models.ridge_regression.standardize(X: array)[source]¶
